Title.evidence: Mobile App vs. In-Person Follow-Up Care After Ambulatory Breast Reconstruction: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive follow-up care via a mobile app or in-person visits

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were ambulatory patients undergoing breast reconstruction.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive follow-up care via a mobile app or in-person visits

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of in-person follow-up visits within 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty-five women were randomised: 32 to the mobile app group and 33 to the in-person group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mobile app group had fewer in-person visits (mean 0.66 vs. 1.64; difference 0.40; 95% CI, 0.24-0.66; P < .001)
